bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Elizabeth Peabody, December 13, 1940

div1.p: Hench informs Peabody that he hopes to have a paper on his yellow fever research published soon. Hench will send her a copy before it is published.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Elizabeth Peabody, December 13, 1940
div1.opener:
Y. F.
December 13, 1940
Miss Elizabeth Peabody
Wilson College
Chambersburg, Pa.
My dear Miss Peabody:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for sending me the list of
the lantern slides. I may call on you for a few of them
later but I believe that I have the most important ones.

Since my return from Washington and Jefferson
I have been so swamped trying to finish a very long medical
paper that I haven't had time to carry on any work or corres-
pondence on the yellow fever problem. The Washington and
Jefferson affair was a lovely one and rest assured that I
intend to follow the matter up. As soon as I can, I will
have the paper published in two or three parts and later
hope to publish an enlarged version, possibly as a monograph.
When I get the manuscript in shape, I will be glad to send
you and your father a copy so that you may see it long before
it is published.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
